c.x: The following rules and regulations have been developed by the Menominee Co
Rules pertaining to wild turkey hunting have been identified in the regulat

c.t: § 529-2 Hunting of wild turkey prohibited; exception.
c.sp: library|Code of the Menominee Indian Tribe|II|529|529-2
library|Code of the Menominee Indian Tribe|II|529|529-3

c.t: § 529-4 Hunting of wild turkey by tribal members; season.
c.sp: library|Code of the Menominee Indian Tribe|II|529|529-4

c.x: Only tribal members will be allowed to hunt wild turkey.
Season for tribal members. Tribal members will be allowed to hunt for wild

c.t: § 529-5 Bag limits and tagging; tribal members only.
c.sp: library|Code of the Menominee Indian Tribe|II|529|529-5

c.x: Only male turkey will be allowed for harvest.
One turkey per tribal member may be harvested.
Tags are not transferable and must be in possession of the eligible hunter.
Individuals 12 years and under will not be eligible for tags.
Bird must be tagged immediately upon killing and registered within 72 hours
Tribal members shall remain in accordance with all applicable laws and rule
All persons are required to process their bird in a timely manner so as not

c.sp: library|Code of the Menominee Indian Tribe|II|529|529-6

c.x: Hunting turkey at night.
Taking turkey from night roost.
Transferring of tags.

c.sp: library|Code of the Menominee Indian Tribe|II|529|529-7

c.x: Be sure of your target and what is beyond it.
Be certain what you see or hear is a turkey not a decoy or another hunter.
Do not wear blue, red or white colors when hunting turkey; these are the co
When still hunting and another hunter approaches use your voice to identify
Never use your turkey call when there are hunters around or near you.
Never hunt with a decoy closer than 200 yards to any road.
